TITLE: De Divina Proportione (Luca Pacioli)
ATTRIBUTION: Pacioli, Luca, approx. 1445-1517. Capella, Antonio, Leonardo, da Vinci, 1452-1519
DIMENSIONS: [6], 33, [1] (blank), 27 (i.e., 26), [25], LXI [i.e., LIX], [2] (1 blank) leaves : ill. (woodcuts) ; 31 cm. (fol.)
DESCRIPTION: De Divina Proportione by Luca Pacioli explores mathematical proportions in art and architecture. The work is divided into three parts and illustrated with geometrical figures, many by Leonardo da Vinci. Title and final leaves are in red and black, with occasional misnumbered or missing plates. Colophons confirm the printer, date, and oversight, while the text demonstrates the harmony of regular solids. This edition showcases the Renaissance fusion of mathematics and visual art.
SUBJECTS: geometry, visual arts (perspective, painting, sculpture), architecture, and music
CONTENT: De Divina Proportione by Luca Pacioli, illustrated by Leonardo da Vinci, primarily covers mathematical proportions, focusing on the Golden Ratio (divine proportion), and its applications in geometry, visual arts (perspective, painting, sculpture), architecture, and music, popularizing geometric concepts and solids like the dodecahedron and icosahedron.
